anime.description: My name is Sasuke. I was a college student, but one day I fell into a time slip back to the Sengoku Period. What`s more is that this Sengoku Period is nothing like what I learned about in the history books... The much anticipated anime version of the popular romance game "Ikémen Sengoku"! A high-tension Sengoku comedy interlaced with adorable generals. Source: crunchyroll

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: fetishes
tag.description: Everything under fetishes (except for Bishounen and Juujin) is strictly only meant for hentai (18 Restricted) and ecchi anime. In case of ecchi, it must be the main element of the show and not when there`s only some of it, for example, there`s some ecchi in Shinseiki Evangelion, but the fact you get to see Asuka`s pantsu doesn`t warrant it the schoolgirl fetish category. So be careful to which ecchi show you add fetishes; it`s fairly straightforward with hentai, though. Overall, this category tree is to satisfy the needs of people with different fetishes, so they can search for what tingles their tangle; hence why this is restricted to hentai and full ecchi shows.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: past
tag.description: Anime that takes place in the past or clearly seems to take place in the past in case of an alternative universe. This category should almost always go together with one of its sub-categories, because the past can either be a depiction of a historical event(s) or not, in which case it would be alternative past.

tag.name: time travel
tag.description: In time travel anime characters are transported through time either figuratively or literally to find themselves either in the past or the future

tag.name: alternative past
tag.description: An anime that takes place in an alternative past is an anime that clearly does not belong to the future or the present, and isn`t tied particularly closely to our history, or has ties to our history but only as a premise: there are too many things that don`t make sense for the time-period. In some cases there is futuristic technology present, but the overall setting still feels that of the past. However the setting must still take place on Earth, since we can not know if the history of a fantasy world is an alternate one or not.

tag.name: historical
tag.description: Historical anime have clear ties to our history and usually occur in a particular epoch.

tag.name: super deformed
tag.description: A caricature style often seen in anime when the character shows extreme emotions, like fear, anger, happiness, surprise, or shame. Seen as cute, as part of humorous comedy. The character`s http://anidb.net/t4055 [face suddenly turns into a simplified version], the body will usually also deform into that of a small child (oversized head, short limbs, extra-large tears).

tag.name: Sengoku period
tag.description: The Sengoku period (戦国時代, Sengoku jidai) or Warring States period in Japanese history was a time of social upheaval, political intrigue, and nearly constant military conflict that lasted roughly from the middle of the 15th century to the beginning of the 17th century. The name "Sengoku" was adopted by Japanese historians in reference to the Warring States period in Chinese history (Sengoku jidai (戦国時代) in Japanese) which preceded the unification of China. Likewise, the Sengoku period in Japan would eventually lead to the unification of political power under the Tokugawa shogunate.

tag.name: tennis
tag.description: Tennis is yet another sport involving hitting a ball. Were it not for the copious amounts of grass involved in certain varieties, it seems hard to imagine that people would pay it any attention at all.

tag.name: game
tag.description: Based on an interactive (even if minimally so) form of entertainment software, generally available for PCs, consoles or arcade machines.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: CGI
tag.description: Computer-generated imagery (CGI) or computer animation is the art of creating moving images via the use of computers. It is a subfield of computer graphics and animation. Increasingly it is created by means of 3D computer graphics, though 2D computer graphics are still widely used for stylistic, low bandwidth, and faster real-time rendering needs. Sometimes the target of the animation is the computer itself, but sometimes the target is another medium, such as film.

tag.name: predominantly male cast
tag.description: The anime features a mostly male cast, i.e. female characters are rare. Example: Reverse harem setting with a plethora of bishounen.

tag.name: short episodes
tag.description: Short episodes are regular episodes that are much shorter than the standard length. This means up to and including 10 minutes; shows with episodes that are 11 to 20 minutes in length are http://anidb.net/t6494 [half-length episodes] instead. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t6349 [multi-segment episodes], which are regular episodes that are split into several short segments (parts), usually with separate titles and independent storylines.

tag.name: 3D CG animation
tag.description: Abbreviation for "three-dimensional computer generated animation" or "computer graphics" (CGI). The traditional 2D art is enhanced by 3D imagery developed through computer modeling software. Done in the right way, this union of 3D in a 2D animated world can be a very beautiful relationship. The difference lies in what lacks the traditional 2D animation all together and may give term to something produced entirely with 3D graphics (such as the 2006 remake of "Appleseed" , 2007`s "Vexille", the 2008 addition to the "Biohazard" series and the more well known "Final Fantasy: The Spirits Within" and "Advent Children").

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: イケメン迷惑矢文
Ikemen Junk Mail
Ikemen Meiwaku Yabumi
episode.summary: As a spy for the Uesugi forces, Sasuke has been spying on the Oda Forces looking for a way to bring them down for his master. One of his suggestions is the idea of junk or spam mail, basically in an attempt to annoy Nobunaga and his men. The men write hundreds of letters and shoot them off, greatly underestimating the kind of men Nobunaga has in his service. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: イケメンヘイメーン
Ikemen Hey Man
Ikemen Hey Man
episode.summary: At one of the regular meetings of the warlords, Date Masamune appears and wants Sasuke to teach him something new for an upcoming poetry competition. Sasuke teaches Masamune and being a quick study the warlord takes to it instantly. The other warlords are inspired and each try their hand at their own rapping style. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: イケメン秘密のスケッチ
Ikemen: Secret Sketch
Ikemen Himitsu no Sketch
episode.summary: Hideyoshi wants to put a new piece of art on a lonely looking wall in the palace with Nobunaga as the obvious subject. He comes up with a plan to distract Nobunaga with the assistance of Sasuke, Ieyasu and Ishida Mitsunari. Ieyasu and Mitsunari are supposed to do the distracting while Hideyoshi does the drawing, but nothing quite goes as planned. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: イケメンスマッシュ
Ikemen Smash
Ikemen Smash
episode.summary: Sasuke is a college student and a history nerd who has made a hobby out of studying time slips. One day, he slips through one of these time slips and finds himself in the Sengoku Period, although it`s nothing like what he`s read about in the history books. He takes the name Sarutobi Sasuke and becomes a retainer of the infamous Oda Nobunaga. His first mission is to win the confidence of Nobunaga`s other famous retainers, Toyotomi Hideyoshi and Tokugawa Ieyasu. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: イケメンパーティーピーポー
Ikemen Party People
Ikemen Party People
episode.summary: With both forces facing off in a series of three challenges on the beach, Oda and his men won the first challenge. The second challenge is a summer time tradition--watermelon splitting! But of course, nothing is traditional with these warlords. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: イケメンビーチ
Ikemen Beach
Ikemen Beach
episode.summary: With things finally coming to a head, the Oda and Uesugi Forces come together at the beach for a final show down. Itching for a fight, Sasuke manages to convince the warlords to participate in a series of challenges to determine who will come out on top. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: イケメンは激怒した
Ikemen Are Furious
Ikemen wa Gekido Shita
episode.summary: Frustrated and fed up with their lack of progress, Uesugi wants to storm Azuchi Castle. Sasuke manages to quell his fury and asks for time in order to negotiate with Nobunaga, leaving Yukimura as a hostage for Uesugi if he doesn`t return. Will Sasuke make it back in time to save his friend? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: イケメン天井裏
Ikemen Attic
Ikemen Tenjouura
episode.summary: Uesugi Kenshin is not the only one seeking Nobunaga`s down fall. The monk, Kennyo, also seeks revenge on Nobunaga and, thanks to some help from Akechi Mitsuhide, manages to sneak into Azuchi Castle. Things seem to be going smoothly until the attic he has snuck into turns out to be much more heavily fortified than he was led to believe. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: イケメン戦国◆時をかけるが物語は終わらない
The Story Won`t End by Crossing Through Time
Ikemen Sengoku: Toki o Kakeru ga Monogatari wa Owaranai
episode.summary: The Sengoku warlords seem to have settled in to the fast pace life of the modern age, much to Sasuke`s chagrin. Not all is quite as it seems though as even despite skyrocketing to idol fame, the warlords from a past have had ulterior motives all along. With another storm rolling in, will Sasuke make it to their final concert in time to say goodbye for real this time? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: さよならイケメン
Goodbye Ikemen
Sayonara Ikemen
episode.summary: Sasuke has confessed to being from the future and explains how his whole adventure began. With time ticking away and the lightning flashing at his heels, Sasuke attempts to say goodbye to his companions. However, this may not really be goodbye... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: イケメンサンダー
Ikemen Thunder
Ikemen Thunder
episode.summary: With Mouri Motonari showing his true colors, Nobunaga, Kenshin, and Shingen temporarily call a truce to work together to take the pirate on. However, the storm that has suddenly rolled in is not any normal storm. Items of Sasuke`s seem to disappear with the suspicious lightning and Sasuke is forced to make a bold confession to his historical companions. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: イケメン危機一髪!
Ikemen Close Call!
Ikemen Kikiippatsu!
episode.summary: The arrival of a mysterious, unexpected visitor has all the men on their toes when the stakes are raised. What was a simple series of friendly matches between rivals has now escalated into a life or death clash for the history books! Source: crunchyroll
